quote: A peel saved is a meal made.
Think twice before you toss, the planet counts the cost.
Lettuce not leaf good food behind.
A second serving is a second chance for food.
One man’s stale bread is another man’s crouton goldmine.
Waste not, guac a lot!
Food waste isn’t punny—so compost away, honey!
The fridge is your best friend—don’t let it turn on you!
Expiration dates aren’t carved in stone. Use your nose!
Bananas are best when life gives them spots.
Love your leftovers like they loved you first.
Bread pudding was born from saving the loaf.
Rotting food stinks, but saving it smells like victory.
Soup sees no ugly vegetables.
Measure twice, cook once, waste never.
Spaghetti night is better when leftovers take the stage.
Bruised fruit makes the sweetest jam.
Plan ahead, and your trash stays light as a feather.
The freezer is a food saver’s time machine.
Cooking is love, but saving food is respect.
Leftovers are just tomorrow’s gourmet meal in disguise.
Skip the landfill; your scraps deserve a dirt nap.
Food waste is trashy; rescuing it is classy.
Every crumb counts in the fight against waste.
